title: How to See Expired & Deleted Craigslist Posts: 2 Easy Tricks

steps.title: Go to https://www.google.com.
steps.content: Go to https://www.google.com . Google stores previous versions of webpages, including Craigslist posts, in their cache. If you remember any information from the post, you might be able to find the most recent version (before it was deleted) in Google's cache. You'll need to act quickly, as Google only keeps a public copy of the page for a short amount of time.

steps.title: Type site:craigslist.org into the search bar followed by any keywords you remember.
steps.content: Type site:craigslist.org into the search bar followed by any keywords you remember. Try to recall information you saw in the post or ad, such as the headline, phone numbers, or company name.

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return . Now you'll see matching results from Craigslist.org.

steps.title: Click ⋮ next to the URL and select Cached.
steps.content: Click ⋮ next to the URL and select Cached . You'll see the three vertical dots on the right side of the search result. If a cached version is available, click Cached to view the previous version of the post. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Get the URL of the post.
steps.content: Get the URL of the post. If you've visited the post before, you can find the URL in your web browser's history . You can use this address to search for cached versions of the post or ad before it expired or was taken down. If you don't have the website's address, then you can't use this method.

steps.title: Go to https://archive.org/web.
steps.content: Go to https://archive.org/web . This takes you to the Internet Archive's Wayback Machine .

steps.title: Enter the URL into the search bar and click BROWSE HISTORY.
steps.content: Enter the URL into the search bar and click BROWSE HISTORY . If the Wayback Machine has any versions of the post in its cache, you'll see a circle around each calendar date a snapshot was made.

steps.title: Click a date to see the version of the post from that date.
steps.content: Click a date to see the version of the post from that date. If the Wayback Machine captured the post before it was removed, you will now see the previous version. If you are logged in on Craigslist and the old post you want to view is your own, you might be able to find it again in My Account as long as you were also signed in when you created that post.

steps.title: Go to https://www.craigslist.org.
steps.content: Go to https://www.craigslist.org . If you're looking for a post that you created but has since expired, you can find it in your Craigslist account information.

steps.title: Click My Account.
steps.content: Click My Account . You'll see it at the top-left corner. If you're not signed in to your Craigslist account, you'll need to do so now.

steps.title: Click All Postings.
steps.content: Click All Postings . You'll see this tab at the top of the page. Here you'll find all of the posts in your posting history. [3] X Research source
